data.enText: time that is spent practising a play or piece of music in preparation for a public performance

data.chText: 我们只有六天的排练时间。
data.enText: We only had six days of rehearsal.

data.chText: 我们的新版《哈姆雷特》正在排练之中。
data.enText: Our new production of ‘Hamlet’ is currently in rehearsal .
an experience or event that helps to prepare you for sth that is going to happen in the future

data.chText: 这些训练是为了准备入侵而进行的演习。
data.enText: These training exercises are designed to be a rehearsal for the invasion.
the act of repeating sth that has been said before

data.chText: 我们听着他没完没了地重复他的论点。
data.enText: We listened to his lengthy rehearsal of the arguments.

tr: repetition of information (silently or aloud) in order to keep it in short-term memory
a practice session in preparation for a public performance (as of a play or speech or concert)
example: a rehearsal will be held the day before the wedding

value.def: A rehearsal of a play, dance, or piece of music is a practice of it in preparation for a performance.

example.ex: The band was scheduled to begin rehearsals for a concert tour...
example.tran: 这支乐队准备开始为巡演排练。

example.ex: When 'Can-Can' was in rehearsal, Porter felt that the title song needed a musical introduction.
example.tran: 在排练《康康舞》的时候，波特感觉主题曲需要一个前奏乐曲。

value.def: You can describe an event or object which is a preparation for a more important event or object as a rehearsal for it.

example.ex: The sketch should be a kind of rehearsal for the eventual painting...
example.tran: 草图应该是最终绘画的某种演练。

example.ex: Daydreams may seem to be rehearsals for real-life situations.
example.tran: 白日梦可能像是真实情景的预演。
